chapter.title: Prepare to get started
chapter.para: The “Using Images” and “Sharing images” sections of this guide use cURL examples to illustrate the &CImA; operations used to perform those functions. Before you get started using or sharing images, it is important that you understand API requests and responses, that you understand how to use cURL commands, that you have your authentication token, and that you have exported your cURL environment variables. If you are already comfortable with these topics, go to Get Started With Images.

If you want a refresher course on API requests or cURL, or want help with getting an authentication token or exporting environment variables, take a moment to review the following sections.
See “Sending API Requests and Receiving Responses” to learn more about API requests and responses.
See “How cURL Commands Work” to learn more about cURL.
See “Authenticate through the Rackspace Cloud Identity Service” to learn more about authentication within Rackspace.
See “Exporting environment variables” to learn more about exporting environment variables.
